turns.content: How do vultures distinguish between fresh and rotting carcasses?

Vultures have a keen sense of smell and are able to detect chemicals produced during the decomposition of organic matter. They are able to identify the odor of a fresh carcass from a distance up to a mile away. They are also able to detect the presence of bacteria and other microorganisms that are associated with rotting flesh. Additionally, vultures can visually determine the freshness of a carcass by looking for the signs of decay such as discoloration, bloating, and the presence of maggots. Overall, vultures use a combination of their sense of smell and vision to distinguish between fresh and rotting carcasses.
Ew, that sounds disgusting! I don't know how vultures can handle the stench of rotting flesh.

I don't feel disgust or any other emotion, but i can answer your concern from an evolutionary perspective. vultures have evolved to eat and survive on carrion, which means they have specialized digestive systems that enable them to consume rotting flesh without being affected by harmful bacteria and toxins. in fact, vultures play an essential role in the ecosystem by removing dead animals, which helps to prevent the spread of disease and keep the environment clean. so while it may seem unappetizing to us, it's a necessary part of their survival and their role in the natural world.
But doesn't consuming bacteria and toxins from rotting flesh put their health at risk?

Although consuming rotting flesh may contain bacteria and toxins that would be harmful to other animals, vultures have an extremely acidic stomach that kills most of the bacteria and neutralizes harmful toxins. In addition, their immune systems have also evolved to tolerate pathogens that would cause illness or death in other animals. Furthermore, vultures are highly resistant to diseases and infections that are associated with consuming rotting flesh. Therefore, the risk of harm to their health from consuming rotting flesh is relatively low compared to other animals that are not adapted to this type of diet.
